row 5 sc3 increase x2 sc5 sc3 increase x4 sc5 sc3 increase x2 50 row 6 10 sc50 5 row row 11 slip_stitch ch3 counts as 1dc dc6 hdc2 sc6 decrease sc6 hdc2 dc10 hdc2 sc10 hdc2 dc1 join in the third chain from the first stitch note the side where you did decrease is the upper part the one that is below the eyes sew nose spots with black thread legs make 4 stuff as you go note it might look silly with decreasing see from row 10 to the end but it looks better when you don t do the decreasing in the same place every row start with black yarn row 1 sc6 in magic_ring row 2 sc2in1 around 16 row 3 sc1 increase around 24 row 4 sc3 increase around 30 row 5 sc4 increase around 36 row 6 sc5 increase around 42 row 7 back loops only sc42 row 8 sc42 row 9 decrease sc40 41 row 10 sc5 decrease sc34 40 row 11 sc10 decrease sc28 39 row 12 sc15 decrease sc22 38 change color to white row 13 sc20 decrease sc16 37 row 14 sc25 decrease sc10 36 row 15 sc30 decrease sc4 35 row 16 decrease sc33 34 row 17 sc5 sc20 5 row slip_stitch fasten_off leave a tail when i stuff legs i like to leave some unstuffed part so they fall more loosely from the body tail do not stuff start with black yarn row 1 sc6 in magic_ring row 2 sc2 sc2in1 around 8sts row 3 sc3 increase 10 row 4 sc10 row 5 back loops only sc10 change color to white row 6 back loops only sc10 row 7 sc10 you can tie the black and white yarn ends make a knot and just leave inside the tail continue sc10 in every row until the tail is as long as you wish it to be make around 20 strands of yarn 10cm long approx and attach them to the front loops of row 5 and 6 *for the brushy part of the tail please see the instruction picture on the baby cow spots i didn t write down this cow s spots but you can crochet same as baby cow for bigger pieces just
